imageManipulation
Class ImageWithoutMessage

java.lang.Object
  imageManipulation.Image
      imageManipulation.ImageWithoutMessage
Direct Known Subclasses:
ImageWithoutMessageEncrypted, ImageWithoutMessageUnencrypted
public abstract class ImageWithoutMessage
extends Image

Author:
John Bannister

This is the master class to create images with messages merged into them. Subclasses will extend to be either encrypted or not encrypted. Objects created from the child classes have methods to save the merged data to a bitmap file.

Method Detail

isEncrypted

public abstract boolean isEncrypted()
Specified by:
isEncrypted in class Image
Returns:
returns true if this object's message is encrypted
See Also:
Image.isEncrypted()

saveImage

public void saveImage()
Tells the image to save itself to a file. Passes this Image to openSave.saveImage()

setup

protected void setup()
The "traffic cop" of the creation of the object. 1. Calls openSave.openImage() to fill the array of bytes from the image file. 2. Creates the array of chars from the message by calling breakoutMessage(). 3. Locates the end of the header information in the image by calling getHeader(). 4. Processes the message into imageryData by calling process() used by constructor.

Specified by:
setup in class Image

breakoutMessage

protected void breakoutMessage()
Populate messageChars with the individual characters of the message. Used by setup().

process

protected void process()
Put the individual elements of the messageChars[] into the alpha channel of the imageBytes[], i.e. after header bytes, every fourth byte can hold a character without affecting the look of the image. Write the message length into an unused byte of the bitmap. Used by setup().

Specified by:
process in class Image

getImage

public byte[] getImage()
Allows the image to be queried for its image data.

Returns:
the array of bytes that make up the image after processing
